title: Crosby Ravensworth Walks

images.caption: Crosby Ravensworth Fell Quarry. Small stone quarry beside the road north-west from Orton. A planning application to expand the quarry has been submitted.

description: This Cumbrian village is located in the Eden district of the county. The pretty village includes an ancient church in a scenic location next to the Dalebanks Beck which runs through the area. This circular walk from the settlement climbs to Crosby Ravensworth Fell where there is an extensive area of limestone pavement and some tremendous views over the area. On the way you will also visit a number of old quarries and the neighbouring village of Oddendale which lies just to the west. On the fell you can also link up with the epic Wainwright's Coast to Coast Walk. This popular trail runs from St Bees Head to Robin Hood's Bay, passing through some of the most dramatic landscapes in the country. To continue your walking in the area visit the historic Shap Abbey or enjoy easy waterside walking on the Appleby Riverside Walk. The circular path around the scenic Wet Sleddale Reservoir lies just to the south west.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Butchers Arms dates back to 1773 and is described as a 'community pub serving fresh homemade food & drinks in a relaxed & warming atmosphere'. You can find them in the village at postcode CA10 3JP for your sat navs. The pub is also dog friendly in the bar area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the south there's the nearby village of Tebay where you will find riverside trails along the River Lune. The village is also known for its 16th century pub and the Tebay Motorway Services. Orton Scar and Great Asby Scar lie just to the south of the fell. These areas of photogenic limestone pavement are a popular place for a walk.

display_address: Crosby Ravensworth, Westmorland and Furness, England, CA10 3JW, United Kingdom
